citations.narrative:
The facility has 2 whelping boxes that have excessive chew damage. The whelping boxes are being used for 2 adult dogs
and 9 puppies, the chew damage is primarily on the top edges and corners of the whelping boxes.
There is also excessive chew damage on approximately three of the rims of the flap door frames and on the synthetic
boards attached to the back wall of the enclosure.
Excessive chew damage can not be easily cleaned and sanitized and can cause sharp edges that can injure the dogs.
The licensee must ensure that all surfaces of the housing facility including houses, dens, and other furniture type fixtures
and objects within the facility that can not be readily cleaned and sanitized are repaired or replaced when worn or soiled.

One plastic bucket being used as a water receptacle had excessive chew damage. The chew damage is primarily along
the top edge of the water bucket that is provided for 4 adult dogs. Water receptacles with excessive chew damage are not
able to be readily cleaned and sanitized and can lead to disease spread in the dogs. The licensee must ensure that all
water receptacles are able to be properly cleaned and sanitized.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 27-August-2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.1(c)(2) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The facility has 2 whelping boxes that have excessive chew damage. The whelping boxes are being used for 2 adult dogs 
and 9 puppies, the chew damage is primarily on the top edges and corners of the whelping boxes.  
 
There is also excessive chew damage on approximately three of the rims of the flap door frames and on the synthetic 
boards attached to the back wall of the enclosure.  
 
Excessive chew damage can not be easily cleaned and sanitized and can cause sharp edges that can injure the dogs. 
The licensee must ensure that all surfaces of the housing facility including houses, dens, and other furniture type fixtures 
and objects within the facility that can not be readily cleaned and sanitized are repaired or replaced when worn or soiled. 
3.10(c) 
   
Watering 
One plastic bucket being used as a water receptacle had excessive chew damage. The chew damage is primarily along 
the top edge of the water bucket that is provided for 4 adult dogs. Water receptacles with excessive chew damage are not 
able to be readily cleaned and sanitized and can lead to disease spread in the dogs. The licensee must ensure that all 
water receptacles are able to be properly cleaned and sanitized. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 27-August-2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
